intro.title: Articles: a, an, the and no article

sections.title: The three choices
sections.content:
English has two **articles**: **a/an** (indefinite) and **the** (definite). Sometimes we use **no article** (written as **∅** in this course): the noun is used without a, an or the.

• **a** – before a consonant sound: a book, a university (yoo-), a one-way street (w-)
• **an** – before a vowel sound: an apple, an hour (silent h), an MBA (em-)
• **the** – when the listener knows which one we mean, or when something is unique
• **∅ (no article)** – plural or uncountable when we talk in general; many fixed phrases (go to work, at home); names (usually)

sections.title: When do we use a/an?
sections.content:
We use **a/an** with singular countable nouns when we mention something for the **first time** or when we mean **one of many** (not a specific one):

• I bought **a** new car. (first mention, one of many cars)
• She's **an** engineer. (one of many engineers)
• We need **a** bottle of water. (one of many)

We use **a** before consonant sounds and **an** before vowel sounds. It's the **sound** that matters: **a** university, **an** hour, **a** European country.

sections.title: When do we use the?
sections.content:
Use **the** when the listener knows **which one**:

• **Second mention:** I bought a car. The car is red.
• **Unique:** the sun, the moon, the internet
• **Generic reference** (the whole species or type): the lion, the telephone
• **Context:** Close the door. (this room's door)
• **Superlatives:** the best, the first
• **Specific set:** The water in the bottle is cold.
• **Some place names:** the USA, the UK, the Czech Republic

sections.title: When do we use no article (∅)?
sections.content:
Use **no article** (∅) for:

• **Plural/uncountable in general:** Cats are animals. Water is important. Life is short.
• **Meals:** We had breakfast. (The breakfast was cold = that specific meal)
• **Places as activity:** go to work, go to school, at home
• **Most names:** London, January, Mary (no the)
• **Abstract/general:** love, happiness, information

Examples: The water in the bottle (specific) vs Water is important (general).

sections.title: Quick summary
sections.content:
• **a/an** – first mention, one of many, singular countable; **a** + consonant sound, **an** + vowel sound.
• **the** – listener knows which one; unique (the sun); second mention; superlatives (the best); specified context; some place names.
• **∅ (no article)** – plural/uncountable in general; meals (have breakfast); go to work/school; most names.
• In this course we write **∅** or say **no article** when nothing is used before the noun.

sections.title: Typical learner errors
sections.content:
• **The with general plural/uncountable:** Wrong: *The cats are animals.* Right: **∅ Cats are animals.** (general)
• **Missing the when specific:** Wrong: *I drank water in the bottle.* (if you mean that bottle) Right: **I drank the water in the bottle.**
• **The with names (when not needed):** Wrong: *I went to the London.* Right: **I went to ∅ London.** (But: the USA, the UK, the Czech Republic – we use the.)
• **A/an with uncountable:** Wrong: *a water, an information* Right: **some water, (no article) information** or **a bottle of water.**
• **Article with go to work/school:** Wrong: *go to the work* Right: **go to ∅ work.** (no article)

questions.question: 'I need _____ umbrella.' Which fits?
questions.explanation: Umbrella starts with a vowel sound → an.

questions.question: '_____ life is short.' (general) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Life in general (uncountable) → no article.

questions.question: 'I bought a car. _____ car is red.' Which fits in the second sentence?
questions.explanation: Second mention – we know which car → the.

questions.question: 'She goes to _____ work by bus.' Which fits?
questions.explanation: Go to work (as activity) → no article.

questions.question: 'We had _____ breakfast at eight.' Which fits?
questions.explanation: Meals in general (have breakfast) → no article.

gapfill.title: Practice: Choose a, an, the or no article (∅)

questions.question: I need _____ umbrella.
questions.explanation: Vowel sound (umbrella) → an.

questions.question: She's _____ engineer.
questions.explanation: Vowel sound (engineer) → an. One of many.

questions.question: _____ sun is very bright today.
questions.explanation: Unique – there is only one sun → the.

questions.question: We had _____ breakfast at eight.
questions.explanation: Meals in general → no article.

questions.question: He goes to _____ work by bus.
questions.explanation: Go to work (activity) → no article.

questions.question: I bought _____ new car. _____ car is red.
questions.explanation: First mention → a. Second mention (we know which one) → the.

questions.question: _____ cats are animals.
questions.explanation: Plural in general → no article.

questions.question: She has _____ hour for lunch.
questions.explanation: Hour starts with vowel sound (silent h) → an.

questions.question: Close _____ door, please.
questions.explanation: The door in this room – listener knows which one → the.

questions.question: They live in _____ USA.
questions.explanation: Country name that includes a common noun (United States) → the.

questions.question: _____ water in the bottle is cold.
questions.explanation: Specific water (in that bottle) → the.

questions.question: It's _____ best film I've ever seen.
questions.explanation: Superlative (best) → the.

questions.question: She studied at _____ university in Prague.
questions.explanation: University starts with consonant sound (yoo-) → a. One of many.

questions.question: _____ life is full of surprises.
questions.explanation: Life in general (uncountable) → no article.

questions.question: I'll meet you at _____ home.
questions.explanation: At home (fixed phrase) → no article.

questions.question: Wrong: 'The cats are animals.' (meaning all cats) Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Plural in general → no article.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I went to the London.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Most city names → no article.

questions.question: Wrong: 'She goes to the work by bus.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She goes to work by bus.
She goes to work by bus
questions.explanation: Go to work (activity) → no article.

questions.question: Wrong: 'We had a breakfast at eight.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Meals in general (have breakfast) → no article.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I need a umbrella.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Vowel sound (umbrella) → an.

questions.question: Wrong: 'He is an university student.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: University starts with consonant sound (yoo-) → a.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Sun is very bright today.' Correct the sentence.
answers: The sun is very bright today.
The sun is very bright today
questions.explanation: Unique (the sun) → the.

questions.question: Wrong: 'They live in USA.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: USA (country name with common noun) → the.
